column1: Deltona is a city in the U.S. state of Florida and the most populous city in Volusia County. It is located on the northern shore of Lake Monroe along the St. Johns River in central Florida. As of the 2010 census
column2: the city population was 85
column3: 182. The city is part of the Deltona–Daytona Beach–Ormond Beach
column5: which is grouped with the larger Orlando-Lakeland-Deltona

column3: was originally established as a planned residential community
column4: and was master-planned and developed by the General Development Corporation and the Mackle Brothers. Since its opening in 1962
column5: the community rapidly grew from a small subdivision to becoming one of largest cities in Central Florida by the end of the 20th century
column6: largely in part by the Mackle Brothers' worldwide marketing efforts showcasing small low maintenance homes offered at affordable prices. The city is mostly residential
column7: and primarily serves as a commuter town for the nearby cities of Orlando and Daytona Beach
column8: as well as its surrounding communities.

column1: The area of current Deltona and surrounding communities was originally inhabited by nomadic Timucuans

column3: steamboats began to make regular trips up the St. Johns River to Lake Monroe. George Sauls
column4: a former secret agent for the Confederacy during the American Civil War
column5: along with his wife Adeline and six children
column6: were the first settlers in the area in 1859. The area was located approximately three miles (4.8 km) north of the community of Osteen. Sauls' homestead caught fire in 1972
column7: but it would eventually be designated as a historical site by the Volusia County Historical Commission

column11: and its site marker has since been relocated to the nearby Osteen Cemetery

column1: Deltona is located in southwestern Volusia County in Central Florida approximately 25 miles (40 km) inland from the Atlantic Ocean
column2: halfway between Daytona Beach and Orlando. It is bordered by Lake Helen and Cassadaga on the north
column7: and Osteen on the southeast. It is included in the Deltona–Daytona Beach–Ormond Beach Metropolitan Statistical Area and the larger Orlando–Deltona–Daytona Beach Combined Statistical Area.

column1: The majority of the land in the city is of karst topography
column2: characterized by rolling hills and an abundant amount of lakes. The St. Johns River passes through Lake Monroe
column3: directly south of the city. The United States Geological Survey lists the city's elevation at 33 feet (10 m) above sea level at a point near Deltona's geographic center. Elevations range from 20 feet (6.1 m) to 112 feet (34 m) above sea level. As of 2010
column4: according to the United States Census Bureau
column5: the city has a total area of 41.1 square miles (106.4 km2)
column6: 37.5 square miles (97.1 km2) of which is land and 3.5 square miles (9.1 km2) of which is water.

column1: Deltona's climate is classified as a humid subtropical climate in the Cfa Köppen climate classification
column2: meaning it typically has hot
column3: humid summers and mild winters. The record high temperature is 103 °F (39 °C) recorded in July 1998
column4: with a record low of 19 °F (−7 °C) recorded in January 1985. Rainfall averages around 53 inches (1
column6: with the wettest months being June through September. The hurricane season lasts from June 1 to November 30
column7: with September as the most susceptible month to hurricanes. The most powerful hurricane to strike Deltona since its incorporation was Charley in 2004
column8: during which the eye of the hurricane passed directly over the city; that same year
column9: the city would also suffer from the effects of hurricanes Frances and Jeanne.

column1: Deltona operates under a commission–manager form of government
column2: consisting of seven elected officials
column3: and an appointed city manager. Residents elect
column5: a mayor who represents the city at-large and six commission members who each represent a specific district of the community. Elected officials serve four-year terms
column6: with a limit of two successive four-year terms. The mayor serves as the presiding officer at official meetings and as the ceremonial head of the city. A vice mayor is elected annually by the city commission from among the commission members. The current mayor is Heidi Herzberg
column7: who was elected into office in November 2018.

column1: No invocation is normally recited at the start of City Commission meetings. However
column2: in June
column4: the national group Americans United for Separation of Church and State
column5: acting on behalf of a Deltona resident
column6: contacted the city's attorneys to advise them that the reading of passages from the Bible by City Commissioner Christopher Alcantara allegedly violates the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment of the United States Constitution. The city responded that “engaging in the recitation of Biblical verse during a public meeting is not in and of itself enough for an Establishment Clause violation.”Citywide public bus transportation and paratransit service is provided by Votran
column7: a public transit service governed by the County of Volusia. SunRail provides commuter rail service to the Orlando area in the neighboring city of DeBary via Votran feeder bus service to the DeBary station
column8: and a 275-space park and ride.  The closest major passenger airport to Deltona is Orlando International Airport
column9: located approximately 33 miles (53 km) south. Additional commercial airline service is provided at Orlando Sanford International Airport
column12: approximately 22 miles (35 km) northeast. Deltona's only limited-access highway is Interstate 4
column13: and traverses through the city's western boundary. Other major highways include Florida State Road 472
column14: which terminates near the city limit in northwestern Deltona at Howland Boulevard
column16: which traverses through the city's southeastern boundary.

column1: The city's water supply and wastewater management is overseen by Deltona Water
column2: a division of the City of Deltona's Public Works Department
column3: with some areas managed by the Volusia County Water Resources and Utilities division. Its main water supply comes from the Floridan aquifer system
column4: one of the most productive aquifers in the world. Commercial solid waste (trash and garbage collection)
column5: and yard waste services are offered through Waste Pro. Natural gas is provided by Florida Public Utilities. Electric power service is provided by Florida Power & Light and Duke Energy. Wired telephone service is provided by AT&T and CenturyLink. Cable television is provided by Spectrum.

column2: 877 students enrolled in its public schools in the 2012–2013 school year. Three private schools are located in the city
column3: offering both primary and secondary education. Higher education is offered by Bethune-Cookman University and Daytona State College through satellite campuses located in the city.

column1: Public primary and secondary education is handled by Volusia County Schools (VCS). VCS operates 2 high schools (Deltona High School and Pine Ridge High School)
column2: 3 middle schools (Galaxy
column3: Heritage and Deltona Middle Schools) and 7 elementary schools within city limits. One elementary school is located in unincorporated Deltona
column4: and four public schools in neighboring communities serve outer portions of the city. In 2010
column5: the Florida Department of Education awarded all public elementary and middle schools in the city "A" or "B" grades based on their performance on the Florida Comprehensive Assessment Test. In 2013
column6: both public high schools in the city received a "B."

column1: Deltona is a part of the Orlando–Daytona Beach–Melbourne media market
column2: which is the 33rd largest radio market and the eighteenth largest television market in the United States. Its primary daily newspapers are the Orlando Sentinel
column4: and the West Volusia Beacon. The city is also served by El Sentinel
column5: the Spanish-language counterpart of the Orlando Sentinel.
